account_data_map.strategic_priority_summary: Unilever is on track to deliver its full year 2024 outlook, with underlying sales growth expected to be within the multi-year range of 3% to 5%, driven by volume growth. The company is investing behind its brands and innovations, and tackling issues through resets and portfolio changes, as part of its Growth Action Plan.
account_data_map.risk_summary:
• Currency fluctuations: Currency had an adverse impact in the quarter of (2.8)%. Most major emerging market currencies depreciated against the Euro in Q3.
• Commodity inflation: Moderate cost inflation is expected due to increases in commodity prices, which may lead to higher pricing over time.
• Supply chain disruptions and logistics challenges: No specific mention, but the company is implementing a company-wide productivity programme.
• Economic pressures and inflation: Weakening consumer sentiment in some markets, deflation in Brazil's fabric cleaning market, and hyper-inflationary pricing in Argentina.
• Competitive dynamics and market shifts: Softening markets in key geographies, but Unilever has seen steady return to healthy top-line growth.
